Title: How to Lose Friends & Alienate People
Author: Peter Straughan

my life so, you know, I'm gonna get drunk.

I thought I had it all figured out. A - get the hell out of Port Huron, come to New York. B - do the serious journalism thing to pay the bills while I, you know, write the novel. C- Win a Pulitzer. E...

D - I don't know what D was. Then I took the internship at Sharps and I met Maddox and he was...he was so...and before I know it I'm writing, you know, Ten Tips for the fucking Metrosexual and pretending this is what I wanted but this ISN'T what I wanted! And that's...that's why I hated you...
...because you were right about me. I'm a ghoul, writing fluff!

But he isn't the person you think he is, okay? Maddox. That's just a front. He thinks he's let himself down by giving up the poetry and he's unhappy. And the marriage is a sham, I mean... I just...I couldn't end it. I just couldn't and...
Fine.
Need a cigarette. Where are my fucking cigarettes?

Do you think I have low self-
When I told him I couldn't see him any more...I don't know if he cared. I love him and, and I don't know if he cares!
I'm so fucking sophisticated! I mean there's not even a little bit of Port Huron left, right?

So, hey, visiting your boy.

A book! Hey - I'm writing a book.
Philosophy? Really? Have you written any...

You're shitting me! Sidney?
I...I don't feel very well.

You do?
I don't know. I don't even know if I'm going to bother finishing it.
Is that from Troy again?
I'll jump in the shower and then I really will get out of your hair.
turntable.

I'm good, thanks.
What are you talking about?
Of course not.
Not at all. Why, she's so thin I could just take her little spindly body and snap it over my knee like a dry fucking twig.
Oh, and for your information Sidney Young has got more going for him than most of the men in this town.
That's why I don't go there any more.
I've been looking for you actually. There's, uh, there's something I need to...
What? I can't understand what you're saying.

The new talent?

Hey.

Rachel!
I don't think we've been introduced?
Are you Lawrence Maddox? The new deputy editor?
Well, I've just come to say congratulations on your promotion.
I'm your present.
Well, Sidney. We've only just met but already I perceive I am in the presence of a rare comic sensibility.

I know your Hi-jinx gave you a certain notoriety back in Olde England but things are going to be a bit different here. Harding wants me to be your Rabbi, show you the ropes. Are you aware of what we do at I Spy?

I Spy is the nation's window onto High Society. The Looky-Loos read us because...well, They Weren't There. The Glitterati read us because we tell them They Were There. For this system to work we have to know where There is.
This isn't a vacation. It's a vocation.
When we do go out you're going to have to wear something more suitable.
Something that covers all of this up.
No, Sidney, that's Richard Heywood. The owner of this magazine.
That's his daughter, Elizabeth; now my wife.
Miss Olsen here takes care of the gallery openings, book launches and other intellectual fare. Can you find our new rookie something to do?
Well, now you're one of the High Priests of what's Hot and what's Not. So what were you two talking about?
Uh-oh. I don't think Miss Olsen approves of you, Sidney.
raisers.
Rachel. How are you?

We're going on to the Circle Club. I'll see you tomorrow.

Right here.

Back in a minute.

Made it all the way to the Seventh Room.

Nope, not you I'm afraid Sidalee.
Hi!

You look totally rexy.
Tell me it isn't so.
Thank God. Can you imagine? He's such a creep.
These are gorgeous, but I'm just too fat.
Thanks.
Well, I'm just wonderful.

Funny I should run into you. I've just done this great little film called Five Boroughs and it's you know, low-budget, first-time director but very, uh, moving and... Hey, maybe you could do a little...?
Is that so?
Right...
What's your name, honey?
Sidney Young. I'll remember that.
wonderful writer. I really felt like he got to the heart of me.

I think this is the worst fundraiser I've been to in my whole life.

Excuse me?
Yeah, have a guess - what is the greatest film ever made?
I'm not wearing a costume.
Idiot.

here with Sophie Maes, I want you to meet her. New film, The Suffragette coming out, the buzz is A-mazing. The release is tied in with the roll-out of the Reebok campaign, and now Louis Vuitton's on the line. This train is leaving the station Lawrence.
I don't really like that word, Sidney.

Such a cynical age. Hello Sidney.
Lawrence is taking us to lunch at Cipriani.

listen...You've met Vincent Lepak haven't you, Sidney?
He has a new movie coming out soon and Lawrence is over-
Well, great. Maybe we could get together and discuss the angle?
Well, I'd need to know how we're going to present Vincent, check the story, so on.
Any stories written about my clients need to be in their best interest, that's all. If things work out with Vincent we could maybe talk about a follow up story on Sophie? What do you think?
Sidney dear, think of it like this: you write about one of my clients, you are borrowing some of their "star-light" to help sell your magazine. All I'm saying is quid pro quo.
Sophie's dog! Have you seen him?
Yes?
I don't think so.
Sophie's going to get a Golden Globe nomination for best actress.
nominated we want Sharps to do a feature. Someone to cover the whole lead up, unrestricted access, the trajectory, the building of this unique brand.

Merry Christmas, Sidney. This is a cover story. I think a little celebration is in order.
What are you doing? Let her go!
What the fuck are you doing?
You're finished! You're finished!
...I just think it's terrible the way we're still exploiting animals. That's why, you know, I won't wear fur or leather, I won't wear make-up, I'm vegetarian.
I don't know. Have you?
No.
I haven't been nominated for anything.
He likes you.
Lawrence? Could I leave Cuba here? He doesn't like Italian food.
Cuba? Cuba?
Cuba? Cuba!
You write poems?
You know what? There's something very damaged about you.
Like an animal that's been hit by a car or something. Like a deer or...like a pig maybe? When they walk funny and the other animals keep away from them. Little limpy pig. I'm drawn to sick animals.
Jesus, I'm wasted. Are you wasted? I'm wasted.
Thanks.
What's what like?
Weird. It's happening so fast and...it's like it's got nothing to do with me. It's like I'm not even really here.
Am I here?
I'm so hungry.
Are you crazy? There might still be a photographer around.
You know what would be nice though? Some coke.
Probably just as well I haven't got any. Coke always makes me so horny.
I'm going to have a logo.
You can be my bitch.
You didn't do it!
You let me down!

What?
That's right! Okay, limpy pig.
Give me your ring.
Give me the ring. I want it.
Okay, give me the ring and if I win tomorrow, I'll let you have sex with me.
You fucking mother-fucking fucker!
I'm sorry, I can't understand your accent?
Aren't you cold?
No, don't! It's so embarrassing!
No, I'd love these but I'm so fat I couldn't...
Oh god, that's so sweet.

Uh, I don't think there really is a mask as such, and I don't wanna be a pain, but what I really wanna talk about is the new play, keep it about the work, you know?
I don't see what the relevance of that is.

Mr Maddox now?
As in, "the Honourable Sidney Young"?
So how come it says "Hon Young"?
Sidney baby, you don't wanna go faking a British title to impress Sophie. It's the Fourth of July.
: We're celebrating the fact that we threw a bunch of British aristocrats out.
How are you?
Has anyone ever told you before that you have an unusually dark aura?
You should walk with bare feet as much as possible, ground all that negative energy.
I'm a spiritual healer.
Oh God no. I'm a dentist. They stare at the party for a moment.
You want to do some coke?
I saw Five Boroughs the other day and wept!
Oh good.
No thank you.
I think it is probably cocaine.
Please, call me Richard. I've written a little book so I'm doing a few talks.
No, nothing so interesting I'm afraid. I'm a philosopher.
I'd love to hear what you think of the book if you have time to read it.
Well, he does have a Masters in the subject.
That would have required you answering one of my calls.

Which reminds me, I was talking to a publisher friend of mine the other day. He mentioned that they were planning a series of introductory texts on philosophers. I wondered if you would be interested?
Of course, of course. I picked up a copy of your magazine at the airport.
It was just a joke Sidney...
I don't think it's worthless. I just think, in your heart, you know you could do more with your life than...
I don't know who...
I don't think you're a disappointment Sidney. I've never thought that.
I'm sorry. I didn't mean to upset you.
If you're not happy...
Einstein said "Try not to become a man of success but rather to become a man of value."
The young lady next door...
I saw the way you looked at her.
I suppose not. But Alison is from Port Huron, isn't she?
Okay, uh...Clark Gable. Go!
Sexiest philosopher?

Soddom and Gomarrah.
